column4: hey guys i just tried booting up my ubuntu laptop and it cant mount the hard drivee. tried booting up a live cd and it wont mount the hd either.
is there anything important on that HD?
yes
when i mount it in the live cd ubuntu it says mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sda1, mising codepage or helper program, or other error
well it could be that the actual hardware broke or just the partition tables or your file system is hosed, any sudden power outage before this problem started?
any clicking from the hd?
its ssd
ext4
aye jaunty
so how do i fix this without loosing data
http://www.pastie.org/636860
Unable to mount 4.0 GB Media         DBus error org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Message did not receive a reply (timeout by message bus)
so whats the verdict
thats all it says in dmesg when i try to mount it
DBus error org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Message did not receive a reply (timeout by message bus)
been running ubuntu for years
just went to boot it uup this morning and it did this first time
how do i check it
k googling now
i had a power outage on ext4 setup cant boot the computer now. what do i do
you may need to boot to miniPE or puppy, not sure if puppy has data recovery tools. Try to recover what you can then reformat the ext4 in question and start over :(
google  for  ext4 partition repair, you may be able to run fschk on it
